summary: This bill, the "No Unreasonable Payments, Coding, Or Diagnoses for the Elderly Act" (No UPCODE Act), aims to improve risk adjustment calculations for Medicare Advantage. It mandates the use of two years of diagnostic data for risk assessment starting in 2026. It also excludes diagnoses collected from chart reviews and health risk assessments. Furthermore, it requires the Secretary to evaluate and publicly report on coding pattern differences between Medicare Advantage plans and traditional Medicare to ensure accurate risk adjustment.
